BitField.Description: If set the the charger suffered a power loss between cycles
If set then the time betweeen charges was onboard (i.e., DC still connected)
If set then a low battery voltage condition occurred between charges

The current indication
Power Derate Status Bit Marsk to indicate the status of each derate sub-channels

The internal Temperature causing derate active
The max internal temperature
The remaining time to start the next Maintenance charge in minutes. max 45 days
The time offset from the start of the frame, in microseconds
The Battery Filtered Voltage is the voltage measured by the charger after low-pass filtering to account for babbledebah and blah de blah.
The Battery Filtered Current is the Battery current measured by the charger.
The Internal Temperature #1 Value records the temperature of the AC Diodes.
The Battery Temperature Value records the temperature seen by the thermistor connected to the battery ground wire.
Charge Indication
Charge Faults Cumulative
Algo State logged by the Algo Engine
The Cumulative Charger Status is a Bitmask where each Bit represents a punchcard-hole for a state that has been achieved during a charge cycle.

BitField.Description: The Bulk Charge Bit is set when the charger exits the Bulk Charge state.
The Finishing Bit is set when the charger exits the Finishing state.

DataField.Description: Whether the alarm/fault started or stopped
The alarm identifier from hmi

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdNotUsed
Item.Description: Placeholder: Not used

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattVInvalidHigh
Item.Description: Threshold from Algo header, alarm managed by platform. Value matches QuiQ flash count, do not change

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattVInvalidLow
Item.Description: Threshold from Algo header, alarm managed by platform.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdChgTimeout
Item.Description: From Algo, Value matches QuiQ flash count, do not change

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattNotQualified
Item.Description: Value matches QuiQ flash count, do not change, TODO: Same as defective? SSP-1609

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdTempTooHot
Item.Description: Indicates that the temperature sensor is Over Temperature

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdExtTempSensorShorted
Item.Description: Indicates that the external temperature sensor is shorted to ground

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdAhLimitExceeded
Item.Description: From Algo

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattTempOutOfRange
Item.Description: The external temperature is too hot or too cold for charging

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdExtTempSensorInvalid
Item.Description: Erratic reading from external temperature sensor.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdDcShortCircuit
Item.Description: Voltage drops below min battery voltage while charging and current output is on

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdExtDisableChg
Item.Description: From SM, TODO: SSP-1595

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattReversePolarity
Item.Description: TODO: SSP-1598

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattNoTakeCurrent
Item.Description: Battery detected, but it does not take current

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdNumCells
Item.Description: SSP-4146 NumberOfCells calculated is suspicious

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdAlgoEocNotSet
Item.Description: Platform has its target voltage set, but Algo (no EOC voltage in header) does not support voltage scaling

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdActiveAlgNotSet
Item.Description: Active Algo not set, chg is not possible

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattVChargeHigh
Item.Description: High Voltage detected during charge

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattVChargeLow
Item.Description: Low Voltage detected during charge

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdAcVoltageHigh
Item.Description: SSP-2091 AC Over Voltage Alarm

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdChargeInitFail
Item.Description: SSP-1667 Charge has started in safemode

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdAcVoltageLow
Item.Description: SSP-1774 Low fault is a ossilating condition is detected

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdScriptFailure
Item.Description: SSP-2909 Indicate that at least one script command failed

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdUSBOverCurrent
Item.Description: SSP-2878 Indicate that USB overcurrent fault detected

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdParserIncompatibleAlgo
Item.Description: SSP-4143 Indicate the parser is incompatible algorithm

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCanBusError
Item.Description: When the charger is operating in remote mode - CAN Bus off or Passive Error detected in CAN bus physical layer, in SW 9.X and above this error has been changed to only show after CAN messages have been received, alarm 67 has been added to show an alarm if a CAN bus physical layer is detected before messages have been received

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBatteryModuleError
Item.Description: Indicate error from Battery Module

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdHalfVccOor
Item.Description: Half Vcc is out-of-range

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCommHeartbeatOrPdoLost
Item.Description: CANopen Heartbeat or PDO lost or J1939 PGN lost. Timeout values depend on configuration but generally set as 5 times Rx messages rate for PGN and PDOs. Default set to 2 Seconds for CANopen Heartbeat for applications usign heartbeat

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdTargetVoltHigh
Item.Description: (battery charged) Target voltage (in platform) is too High for the current model

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattCapNotSet
Item.Description: Battery Capacity not set (either ALGO needs it, but platform not set, or the other way around

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdTargetVoltLow
Item.Description: (battery charged) Target voltage (in platform) is too low for the current model

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdNoTbattSensor
Item.Description: Alarm managed (set/cleared) by platform. Battery temp sensor is required by ALG, but not installed

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCANDownloadFailed
Item.Description: SSP-5095 Indicate that CANOpen download failed

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdFanError
Item.Description: Error condition has been detected on a fan

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBtnStuckDown
Item.Description: Button stuck in down position

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdFanSupply
Item.Description: Fan Supply Voltage Dropped too much. Non-latching

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdSwInternal
Item.Description: Software internal fault. such as out of monitor

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCanCfgError
Item.Description: CAN Configuration error. Defaults used. Check syslog for more information.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCanOpenPdoCrcErr
Item.Description: CANopen PDO and J1939 PGN CRC error.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCanOpenPdoSeqErr
Item.Description: CANopen PDO sequence count error.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattDisconn
Item.Description: Battery voltage below battery disconnect threshold.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdInvPdoLen
Item.Description: Invalid CANopen PDO length.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdBattPlatformOverVoltage
Item.Description: Voltage on the battery terminals exceeds the rating of the hardware.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllChgMultiMaster
Item.Description: Parallel Charge multiple master

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllChgOutOfResource
Item.Description: Parallel Charging - Out of Resources

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllUnexpectedMessage
Item.Description: A Parallel charging disabled unit has received Parallel charging specific CAN messages

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllNoMaster
Item.Description: A Parallel charging enabled slave unit has not detected a Master device on the CAN bus

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllMissingSlaves
Item.Description: A Parallel charging enabled master has not detected the expected number of slaves on the CAN bus

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllSlaveLost
Item.Description: A Parallel charging slave has stopped communicating with the master

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllSlaveReversePolarity
Item.Description: A Parallel charging Master raises this alarm when one or more of its Slaves report reverse polarity on their DC connections.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllSlaveDcConnection
Item.Description: A Parallel charging slave's DC output disconnected or appears to have excessive cable resistance.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdRemoteDeviceError
Item.Description: Error detected with an associated device. A stack Master may raise this alarm if one of its slaves reports an error. The VCIM may raise this if a connector charger reports an error.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdBmsRespTimeout
Item.Description: BMS Response Timeout

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdNmDownEvt
Item.Description: Network Management (NM) Down Event

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdJ1939AddrViolation
Item.Description: J1939 Address collision with another device on the bus that cannot be resolved. Typically because the other device is non-compliant.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdNeverRxedMonMsg
Item.Description: A monitored message (i.e., with a receive timeout; e.g. RPDO or PGN) has never been received from the BMS yet, but the charger is ready to start.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdExtCurrentSense
Item.Description: The external sensed current provided over CAN differs too much from the charger(s) sensed current.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdExtVoltageSense
Item.Description: The external sensed voltage differ too much from the charger(s) sensed voltage.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdPlllSlaveCfgErr
Item.Description: The master has detected an incompatible slave on the bus

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdJ1939CannotClaimAddress
Item.Description: The device has failed to claim or has lost its address on the bus

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdJ1939OtherDeviceCannotClaimAddress
Item.Description: Another device on the bus hs reported that it cannot claim an address

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlmIdHighBatteryVoltageSense
Item.Description: Battery voltage is greater than a software configued max allowed limit while charger is charging, if no software configured value is provided, this alarm will take the max hardware voltage as the limit. Alarm 47 allready provides the function against hardware max voltage, so it is suggested to only use this alarm when a software max voltage limit is applied.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCanBusErrBeforeMonMsg
Item.Description: When the charger is operating in remote mode - CAN Bus off or Passive Error detected in CAN bus physical layer; detected before any messages have been received. Should be used in conjunction with E029

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdCommMsgLostOutputOff
Item.Description: Monitored PGN/PDO message lost while charger output if off. Timeout values depend on configuration but generally set as 5 times Rx messages rate for PGN and PDOs. Default set to 2 Seconds for CANopen Heartbeat for applications usign heartbeat

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdEvseNotCompatible
Item.Description: The Charging Station (EVSE) currently connected to the vehicle is not compatible.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdLockFailure
Item.Description: The lock failed to either lock or unlock.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdEvseNotPowered
Item.Description: The Charging Station (EVSE) is connected to the vehicle but appears to be powered off. (State E)

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdEvseReportedFault
Item.Description: The Charging Station (EVSE) is reporting a fault. (State F)

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdEvseFault
Item.Description: Fault detected with the EVSE and/or the external cables.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdVcimProxOpenCircuit
Item.Description: Fault with internal vehicle wiring of the Proximity circuit

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdVcimProxShortCircuit
Item.Description: Short circuit on the Proximity circuit

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdVcimProxUnstable
Item.Description: Proximity voltage invalid or erratic

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdVcimIllegalDutyCycle
Item.Description: Control Pilot PWM Duty Cycle has an illegal value

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarm12VSupplyOor
Item.Description: 12 V Supply is out-of-range

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmDetectingCharger
Item.Description: Fail to detect remote charger, or charger goes quiet for unknown reason while being powered

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmACCPWROutputOverCurrent
Item.Description: SSP-9589 add ACCPWR Output Over Current Alarm

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eAlarmIdEnd
Item.Description: Number of alarms

DataField.Description: The fault identifier from hmi

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdNotUsed
Item.Description: Placeholder: Not used

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdLlcExcessiveLeakage
Item.Description: SSP-1602: DCDC excessive leakage, a sign of short circuit or shoot through on DCDC output

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdPfcExcessiveLeakage
Item.Description: SSP-1603: PFC excessive leakage, a sign of short or shoot through on PFC output, or DCDC

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdPfcBoostFailed
Item.Description: PFC failed to boost the PFC output voltage

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdOffsetCalFailed
Item.Description: SSP-2234: DCDC/battery current sense/command offset calibration failure.

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdDcRelayFault
Item.Description: SSP-4478: voltage across DC relay too high, DC output relay may have bad contact

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdDCDCCurrent
Item.Description: SSP-1661: difference between DCDC current sense and battery current sense out of range

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdElectricalFault
Item.Description: SSP-6556: Electrical HW fault. e.g. DCDC Stuck on (can not turn off).

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdFree4
Item.Description: TODO: SSP-1605 / SSP-1607 / SSP-1608

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultAlgoException
Item.Description: SSP-8395: CHG ENG has exception!

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultConnectedCharger
Item.Description: Another charger on the bus has a hardware fault

Item.Name: ALMFLT_eFaultIdEnd
Item.Description: Number of faults

DataField.Description: Vcc / 2
The PFC Voltage is the pfc bus voltage measured by the charger in Q2.
The Temperature of the Input Stage as detected by the charger sensor T1 in Q2.
The Temperature of the Output Stage as detected by the charger sensor T2 in Q2.

The DC Voltage is the voltage measured internally by the charger.
The Internal DC Current is the DC current measured by the charger.
This is the repeat count for run-length compressing of events in the log.

DataField.FullName: Hash-based ID for events logged from charger
DataField.Description: Each event has a name that hashes to a unique 16-bit number. This allows us full use of the 16-bit id range without the overhead of doing manual id assignments to events.
Each event can have one or more parameters packed into the native processor word. These packed params are copied to this field verbatim.
The maximum voltage sense absolute difference in UINT16_Q8.
The voltage sense difference( external - internal) average in INT16_Q7.
The voltage sense difference update count in UINT32
The maximum current sense absolute difference in UINT16_Q8.
The current sense difference( external - internal) average in INT16_Q8.
The current sense difference update count in UINT32
